snippet: Scientists believe the islands’ lone land mammal, now long extinct, got there about 18,000 to 25,000 years ago across a shallow strait that would periodically freeze.
abstract: Study in journal Nature Communications suggests that Falkland Islands wolf, extinct animal that was the only land-based mammal native to islands, may have traveled across thin, shallow strait from mainland when it was frozen over.
lead_paragraph: Scientists believe the islands’ lone land mammal, now long extinct, got there about 18,000 to 25,000 years ago across a shallow strait that would periodically freeze.

headline.print_headline: Migration: Ancient Strait Is Clue in Falklands Wolf’s Origin
headline.seo: Clues to Origins of Falkland Islands Wolf
headline.main: Ancient Strait Is Clue in Falklands Wolf’s Origin
